description: Really, really great experience. Wonderful vegan food, and a ridiculously nice waitress. The prices are something to watch out for, but overall it was a really enjoyable breakfast.
author: Eva J.

description:
I can't help it.  Yes the service is still slow, but they are really nice people and you almost feel like you are hanging out at their kitchen at home, and you can't expect restaurant like service at someone's home.  The food is still very yummy, and they do a good job of providing veggie options.

Deal with the wait and enjoy the food.  :)
author: Nicole T.

description: This place is awesome and opens at 7am on Sundays. Great b-fast burrito and my eggs with chorizo were awesome.
author: Richard I.

description: Wonderful neighborhood breakfast cafe. My kids and I thoroughly enjoyed it (and they are often hard to please). The food was fresh and delicious. My kids are not vegan but I am and I loved that they offer vegetarian and vegan options on their breakfast menu! What a treat!
author: mara t.

description: The pupusas here are delicious and cheap, there are lots of vegetarian and vegan options, and everything tastes great. Awesome restaurant, laid back atmosphere, and a good place to watch the World Cup while you eat. Highly recommended.
author: Will M.

description: This is it - have only been here a couple times and yet, some of the best pupusas I've had, SUPER nice service and delicious other dishes = 5 stars, yo. They also have a special during mission street fairs on first fridays - $3 for 2 DEELISH pupusas (not like they really need to be cheaper). Go for the loroco with cheese! Only downside is that the sauce is not as spicy/garlicky as I've liked it other places, but that is seriously the *only* downside. Enjoy, folks!
author: Ara S.

description: We hopped out of the house without any breakfast, on a donut mission, and on the way back, decided to try Sun rise, because I remembered it's supposed to be good for breakfast. It was probably around 1pm on Saturday, and we were seated right away. This place is a mix of latin American and American food. There were a lot of egg options and some vegan options too, for you vegan people. I noticed they even have vegan French toast. Both of us had the huevos al gusto, which I thought was an egg scramble or an omelet or something, but it wasn't (I liked it anyway). Honestly, I picked it because it was the only thing that had plantains in it (although you can order them as a side). You get laid out separately on a plate: two eggs, made whatever way you want, plaintains, fresh cheese, sour cream, salsa, and some yummy beans and rice (that beans & rice was soo good). Plus a side of 3 hand made tortillas to eat them with. I didn't have a big appetite and by a little after the first tortilla, I was getting full, but I pulled through and ate almost everything. Roomie ate all of his and felt hungry still. He liked it, but felt maybe it was a bit too homestyle for him, like we could have made it. I reasoned that we probably could, but when do we ever make beans & rice, or fry up some plantains? Never. He conceded my point. We both did enjoy the dish and prices were very cheap ($8 for that egg dish), it cost about the same for 2 breakfasts here as it did for half a dozen donuts up the street. Service was friendly, and there were other things I'd definitely try. The one thing neither of us liked was the chai. It was too sweet, it tasted like it was a mix. I couldn't finish it. There was no spiciness, no bite, although they did make it with soy for us. Do go there, do try the yummy food and friendly service, don't order chai. Oh, and I think they serve breakfast all day, but not only breakfast. There is regular lunch/dinner food here too, I should have tried their papusas.
author: Merredith L.

description: Meh-inspiring breakfast for a not so cheap price. Potatoes were bland, "fresh fruit" means more like 1 apple slice and 1 orange slice. On the plus side, the serving of orange juice was healthy and the coffee was decent. Over all, would not recommend.
author: Ben G.

description: This place is great.  The food is super tasty and affordable.  It's a great breakfast joint if you want to skip the wait, and the woman who runs it runs all sorts of benefits for causes in the area.
author: Gabby G.

description: love, love, love this place! went for the first time and the soyrizo burrito was amazing! everything on the menu looks delicious and I'm definitely going back!
author: Cynthia G.

description: This is by far my favorite place to eat breakfast, brunch, or lunch. I've never had dinner there, but I'm sure it's just as delicious and well priced as the other meals. This is my 'go to' place for friends in town, and where me and the roommies go for brunch on the weekend. There's great options for all dietary needs meat eaters, vegetarian and vegan. Beware the breakfast portions aren't huge, but definitely enough. Fried plantains best I've had in the Mission. I've never had a problem with the service, it's always been speedy, but I always pay by walking up to the counter. Extremely friendly service, and great ambience, I love the paintings on the wall, that I think are done by locals and are switched out every so often.
author: Jocie M.

description: My SO and I had walked past this place a million times and finally stopped there for breakfast a few weekends ago and have since been back with friends.  The food was delicious (everything we ordered both times), Including the vegetarian food that I ordered.  I was impressed with how many vegetarian and vegan options there were on the menu.   The food was an excelled value for the price, and best of all the place felt sunny and cozy even with the rain pouring down outside.  I can't wait to share another breakfast with friends at this place.
author: Katie V.

description: It had a nice atmosphere and the service was nice, but the breakfast burrito I ordered was kinda small and not that good.
author: simon m.

description: I think I found my new weekend brunch location when I'm hung over and in no mood to fight the crowds at St. Francis or Universal. We walked in here around noon or 1ish on a Sunday and there were only maybe 2 other parties in there. Service was a little on the slow side but they were always happy to refill my coffee. I ordered the Sunrise Eggs, which was poached eggs with avocado and spinach on english muffin. Light and satisfying. The homefries could have been a little crispier but that's a personal preference. My roommate ordered a dish with eggs, plaintains, beans, and tortillas and that looked really good. Definitely planning on going back!
author: Susan L.

description: The food is really tasty, really reasonably portioned, and really sensibly priced. The server (maybe also the owner), Alba, is so very sweet. I usually get pupusas (minus revueltas) which are, to be fair, delicious as all get-out no matter where you go. Sometimes tamales. Today I had chilaquiles with soyrizo, topped with a little sour cream and a good portion of some very enjoyable queso fresco, plus a glass of horchata. The place is rarely crowded, and even so no one hovers over you. It's a very peaceful little kitchen to which I find myself returning time and time again.
author: Hannah V.

description: This is hands down one of the best breakfast places in SF! Anything from the Latin American side of the menu is sure to be outstanding. Lead chef and co-owner Alba created her menu to also be very healthy so you won't find this food overly greasy! The Pupusas are especially good because of this.
author: Emily C.

description: Incredible find in the Mission. Went for Sunday brunch at about 11:45: sat right down, service a little slow with ordering and drinks, but the food came out quick and hot. Had most of the vegan items on the menu: amazing breakfast burrito (do not miss the soyrizo), french toast with fruit, tamales, spinach pupusas and plantains. I thought we were ordering too much, just so we could try lots of different things, but the sizes are smallish, so it turned out to be the perfect amount for two hungry people. Incredibly delicious across the board. Definitely worth the trip.
author: Amanda M.

description: i got the chilaquiles and a side of plantains. so amazing!! and all these prople complaining about service? impatient! the chilaquiles are worth a short wait.
author: Wes B.

description: Came here with brother and a friend of his to watch the semi-final world cup games. I ordered the chilaquiles which came with sour cream and refried beans, and coffee. The menu has some vegan options too, including vegan pupusas made with beans and zucchini. The owner was friendly and attentive, offering to refill my cup of coffee in between my yelling at the screen. All in all the best way to wake up early: semi-final soccer match, black coffee, and a comforting dish.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: Awesome, cheap brunch! The chilaquiles are particularly good. The service was friendly but not exactly with it. On the plus side, the waitstaff doesn't seem to cafe if you bring your Philz in with you :)
author: Anonymous F.

description:
I'd call it a best kept secret, but by the looks of things, it looks like the word is out.  Every time I visit  it seems a little more crowded and the day is fast approaching when I'll actually have to wait for a table.  While my selfish side finds this a little upsetting, the people who run the place are super-sweet and they do a great job, so I wish them all the best.  

This is a perfect spot of a quick (for now) yet filling breakfast when the rasberry rosemary bread at Philz(across the street) won't cut it and you don't want to stand in line (or your're not feeling hip enough) for St. Francis etc.  THey've got a fine selection of American and Mexican breakfasts and everything is always delicious, although I rarely venture far from my standby: Huevos al Gusto, which includes, eggs, rice & beans, queso fresco, corn tortillas, and plantains or avocado  It's like 7 or 8 bucks and hits the spot every time.  Throw in a large OJ and you're primed for a good day at around $10.  

Mark my words, there will be a wait soon.  GO!
author: matthew r.

description: I had the eggs florentine. They were really gross. everything was soggy accept for the eggs that were like tennis balls. It was wrong on so many levels. The service was really bad which I can generally excuse for great food but it seemed like the only redeeming quality to the food was that there was plenty of it. Too much of a bad thing anyone? My girlfriend loves the huevos rancheros so I may have to give it a second shot and steer clear of the hollindaise.
author: Dian N.

description:
I went in once when they first opened and was disappointed.  They must have been just getting things figured out, because every time I've been back since has been wonderful.

Their breakfasts are wonderful.  I had the chorizo scramble this morning, but with soy chorizo.  It was incredible.  A huge portion of black beans and fresh mexican cheese along with it.

Their pupusas are really nice, though having been to Central America, I'm rather picky.  Fresh salads, nice art, and never too crowded.  I totally recommend this place.
author: Jeff W.

description: definetly one of the best latin american places in the mission , food portions for the price are really huge and the quality makes the whole experience amazing , had lomo al gusto i think it is a new dish on the menu , rice is perfect and different thick and moist , amazing black means, they have home made french fries ,yes you heard no costco bullshit, ceasar salad had a whole chicken on it for not even 7 bucks , great great place will definetly go for breakfast , heard good things about that
author: NAEL K.

description: Arrived at 9:15 in a rested mood. Was not acknowledged at the door. After ordering, server forgot to bring the OK coffee and water to our table. I could had made better coffee with my jar of Classico Nescafe. Latin breakfast include too much beans. Had to eat tortillas to fill me up. Maybe we showed up before the owners arrived. Looked to be busy as we left. Could be just a bad meeting. Never had a bad meeting at El Taco Loco or Chez Maman. My father felt bad and it was not his fault. Will do better next weekend at another place.
author: Robert G.

description: Good breakfast.  Only thing I knock them down a star for is service, because it was rather slow considering we were one of 3 tables there. But the chorizo and eggs, plantains and beans were the shiz!  Papusas rocked too.  Just wish we could have gotten water refills sooner, thats all.  Good and uncrowded otherwise.  They take cards too!
author: Suzanne L.

description: The only thing I've had here is the their pupusas. We used to buy lunch from them every saturday but have since migrated toward El Farolito. The pupusas are good, nothing to rave about. I think we kept coming back because they only charged us $1.00 per pupusa. You can't find a cheaper pupusa anywhere else.
author: Erika A.

description: My brother and I took a morning trip into the mission after having read great reviews of this place on Yelp.  Being a vegan, Maeve C's review about the vegan breakfast burrito really called to me.  We were STARVING when we got there, I ordered the burrito and the vegan tamale as a side.  Very cute little place, brightly lit and a sunny color scheme.  Great service, food came quickly (although not very crowded as it was a Monday around 11:30).  My brother got the Sun Rise Eggs.  I LOVED my food, not too greasy, very filling and satisfying, great flavors.  Bro really enjoyed his too although not as crazy as I was about mine.  Whoever wrote that the trick is to order Mexican and not American must be right.  Anyway, VERY reasonable prices and in a nice location.  I would definitely go back; I don't live in SF but I'm sure my brother will and will take his girlfriend.  Would love to try the vegan french toast next time.
author: AnnaKarina M.

description: Sun Rise is great for a number of reasons. I tend to always get their huevos al gusto, which is an awesome breakfast of eggs, rice & beans, corn tortillas, fresh cheese, sour cream, fried plantains, and salsa. DELICIOUS! If you've ever ordered a basic egg breakfast and ended up with a boring plate of food you could've cooked at home, this is the antidote. My roommate got the chilaquiles which was also amazing. Finally: no line, no wait on the weekends, which is greatly appreciated in the Mission at brunch-time.
author: Anna C.

description: great pupusas and pastel.. oh ya and yuca!
author: Art A.

description: Fantastic!!  Delicious food, heaven for vegetarians looking for stick to your ribs food.  Had vegan chorizo, plantains cooked perfectly, beans, and rice pupusas.  Yes, you heard me, rice pupusas, which are extremely hard to find unless you are eating in someone's home.  The vibe was mellow and warm, the service was good and did I mention that the food was absolutely delicious!!  Solidly priced and delicious.  I've found my new spot!
author: Tonya A.

description: A for effort with the vegan and vegetarian options. Now if someone could really show them how to make a tofu scramble (with nutritional yeast) and actually spice up the vegan burrito. It's great to see this place transitioning while so many small restaurants on lower 24th are going out of business these days. The atmosphere is really nice and the service is great. If you live in the neighborhood give it a try.
author: Tim H.

description: Great alternative place for brunch.  Good prices and friendly staff.
author: David A.

description: The dishes was small, and the taste very plane... The worse bathroom in the world
author: Julie C.

description: Greatest breakfast in San Francisco! This is a fantastic restaurant, that has a really genuine family feeling to it. Their Huevos al gusto with plantains will knock your socks off. But don't take my word for it. Get your butt down there and say hi to Alba. She'll treat you like royalty and feed you the best Salvadoran breakfast known to man.
author: josie b.

description: oh brunch...let me count the reasons why you really are my favorite meal...i love you for the crispy plantains, the fluffy eggs, the rice and beans and the fresh salsa...what a great way to start my day.
author: hollie m.

description: i went to this place once and i ordered a regular breakfast like sausage eggs bacon toast. when i tried the sausage it tasted like bull crap i only got one egg and my bacon was burned. the only good thing i had from that breakfast was toast. heres a reality check dont be cheap  or people will not come back.
author: Roger J.
